> [{quoted}](name=dunkeroni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8LAfusJA,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2016-05-28T04:15:04.410+0000)

> They're adding in a way to get shards with IP in a future patch. Just be patient.

This doesn't actually solve the core problem here, which is that mastery of a champion is still gated by something completely unrelated to that mastery.  The current implementation is obviously unacceptable, requiring RP to get any reasonable amount of mastery, but allowing IP really doesn't solve anything as comprehensively as I think people want.

Each champion shard, when disenchanted, is worth somewhere in the ballpark of 200-400 blue essence.  This means that every mastery level will require roughly 2-3 champion shards, and depending on the cost this can add up.

Let's say that each champion shard costs 1000 IP, right?  This means that every mastery level costs 2000-3000 IP, and if we assume an average IP gain of 80 per game this means every mastery level takes about 25-37.5 games **in addition to the mastery totals already gained beforehand**.

---

You know what would be a more organic way to do this?  Disenchanting mastery tokens into white essence that can then replace blue essence in the recipe for mastery.  Not only does this encourage playing the champion well for longer, it means that champion mastery can be earned exclusively by dedicating oneself to a champion and playing that champion well.  Isn't that the entire point of Champion Mastery to begin with?

I'm sure you can get 1000-2000 IP by playing that champion if you want. Don't most CHAMPIONS cost more than that, and by the mechanics of how purchasing things works, THAT has is completely unrelated to the champion as well.

Essentially what you've suggested is that getting S rank on any champion allows you to upgrade the champion you want with 'white essence', which again is unrelated to the champion.

The way it is now, you can get up to mastery 5 by just playing the champion, after that you need to get S ranks. You could just keep playing that champion if you want, but it won't get you 6-7 any faster after you already have your S tokens. For that you have to actually decide that you WANT that champion to get mastery 6-7 by spending something that is untied to that champion specifically. This means you can't automatically get mastery 6-7 on every champion that you play enough, because those mastery points should indicate that you not only are good, but you want to show it off on that champion more than any others. This means that players with higher masteries actually like the champion enough to upgrade it, instead of just showing that they play enough to accrue a huge pile of mastery points (like with lv 5 masteries).

In short: If mastery 6-7 had the same progression as every other mastery (or some bastardized version where you earned points to be converted into other points by playing the same champion), then it would be just as meaningless as mastery 5. The way it is now, higher masteries are actually something precious that you have to choose above other masteries.

> [{quoted}](name=dunkeroni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8LAfusJA,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-28T08:15:56.791+0000)

If White Essence is gained by disenchanting mastery tokens, it becomes a self-contained system.  I may not need mastery with that particular champion to obtain the white essence requirement, but I still need the tokens specific to that champion.  My ability to play the game at a high level consistently would be enough to let me show my mastery, and would be **far** more relevant than my ability to pay RP/IP for the same result.

> The way it is now, you can get up to mastery 5 by just playing the champion, after that you need to get S ranks. You could just keep playing that champion if you want, but it won't get you 6-7 any faster after you already have your S tokens. For that you have to actually decide that you WANT that champion to get mastery 6-7 by spending something that is untied to that champion specifically. This means you can't automatically get mastery 6-7 on every champion that you play enough, because those mastery points should indicate that you not only are good, but you want to show it off on that champion more than any others. 

What about people with hundreds of thousands of mastery points on a particular champion that don't want to spend RP or IP just to show that they are dedicated to that champion?  Do these people not deserve to be able to show mastery simply because they aren't willing or able to spend high amounts of resources?

>This means that players with higher masteries actually like the champion enough to upgrade it, instead of just showing that they play enough to accrue a huge pile of mastery points (like with lv 5 masteries).

I have thirteen mastery tokens that I can't spend because of the arbitrary essence restriction.  I love each of these champions, but because I'm unwilling to spend RP (soon IP) I am not allowed to show that I am dedicated to them.  I've demonstrated my time investment by accruing enough mastery points and I've demonstrated my skill by accruing enough mastery tokens, so why can't I show off these achievements?

> In short: If mastery 6-7 had the same progression as every other mastery (or some bastardized version where you earned points to be converted into other points by playing the same champion), then it would be just as meaningless as mastery 5. The way it is now, higher masteries are actually something precious that you have to choose above other masteries.

Higher masteries are essentially only precious right now because they require spending RP (or dumb luck), which is a terrible way to restrict the system.  IP has the exact same problems, but since it's an easier resource to obtain than RP it's at a lower grade.
It seems like it would be just as effective to require a couple more tokens per level and remove the essence requirement altoghther.

True story.  I would have liked to see Riot continue to extend the mastery point requirements just like the previous levels along with the addition of the mastery tokens.  Accumulating mastery points accomplishes the exact same thing as grinding for IP when it comes to this system, which is to prolong and stretch the time investment required for mastery, but it is a **much** more organic way to do it.  

Mastery points are already set as a precedent for levels 1-5, it just makes logical sense for those point requirements to continue through levels 6-7.

I actually like that you can achieve 6 & 7 with relatively few games played. I'd rather see a lvl 8 or 9 with a higher mastery point requirement. Then it's kind of like:

(5) Anyone can get here with a bit of grinding, it shows you know the champion pretty well.
(6/7) In order to get here, you need to actually be good at your champion.
(8/9+) You're both really good at your champions AND a die-hard main. 

It'd be cool to offer chromas of base skins for reaching a certain level of mastery.

From the Mastery Level's announcement page:

"We’re emphasizing a performance requirement alongside a dedication component (the time needed to unlock free chests or earn IP for the champ shards or permanent loot) to build on the original system’s blend of skill and participation."

The reason Mastery Levels 6 and 7 are gated by the chests and IP/RP is that it is extremely easy now to get the Mastery Tokens. Honestly, they don't really show mastery very well. Why? Because you can earn them in the Rotating Game Modes (particularly URF) with minimal effort and it's very easy for you to play a game with your friends and have them funnel kills to you all game so that you get those S ranks.

Even requiring IP makes it so you have to REALLY show your dedication to that champion - "I am willing to give up a full champion/runes/whatever in order to show that I have mastered this champion". 

Honestly, it would probably be better if you could only use IP (not RP) to advance mastery levels, since that would really limit how many champions anyone could have at levels 6 and 7 (or above) and make those levels even more special and meaninful.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralimak,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8LAfusJA,comment-id=0003000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-05-28T13:37:47.175+0000)

You know what else is **already implemented** as a dedication component, showing the time needed?  Mastery points.  Instead of requiring 3000 IP for a mastery level Riot could have just as easily decided that an additional 25k mastery points would be required to fulfill this dedication component.  

It's the simplest solution and by far the most logical, and as per Occam's Razor the simplest solution is usually the best.

> The reason Mastery Levels 6 and 7 are gated by the chests and IP/RP is that it is extremely easy now to get the Mastery Tokens. Honestly, they don't really show mastery very well. Why? Because you can earn them in the Rotating Game Modes (particularly URF) with minimal effort and it's very easy for you to play a game with your friends and have them funnel kills to you all game so that you get those S ranks.

* Step 1: Remove mastery tokens from rotating game modes if it's a problem.
* Step 2: Increase the number of mastery tokens required if they can be earned too quickly.

There are so many levers Riot can use to gate levels 6/7, but for some reason they decided to use basically the most illogical method possible (RP) and are going to be adding the second most illogical method possible (IP) at a later date.

> Even requiring IP makes it so you have to REALLY show your dedication to that champion - "I am willing to give up a full champion/runes/whatever in order to show that I have mastered this champion". 

Is there a reason it shows dedication more to force the player to restrict other purchases (champions, runes, etc.) than it would be to require the same amount of time through a higher mastery point requirement?

Yeah, and they absolutely will add a replay feature.

And give us soloQ as an alternative.

like, the whole process

Say you want the Teemo mastery. First you need to get mastery 5 on Teemo.

Then whenever you get an S- or better playing Teemo, you get a "Teemo Mastery 6" token or something of that nature. You have to accumulate 2 of them. In order to actually use them, you either need 500 blue essence, a Teemo shard, or a Teemo permanent. All of those can only come from chests. The statistically most probable way of unlocking the Mastery 6 icon is getting random champion shards and disenchanting them. It takes around 2-3 champion shards to get 500 blue essence. 

Then whenever you get a S or better playing Teemo, you get a "Teemo Mastery 7" token. You need 3 of them. Similar conditions to actually unlock the Mastery 7 icon. 
____________________________
This thread is aimed at the point of getting chests. You have two options in getting chests - buying them or unlocking them through the weekly "quest". Since you can only earn 1 chest per champion until it resets, youre forced to play other champions and either obtain a S or have a teammate obtain an S if you dont want to pay.
